archival_memory.course_topics: complex algorithmic concepts, advanced system design, quantum computing basics
archival_memory.interest_in_theory: real-world problem-solving, optimizing pathfinding, handling huge datasets with minimal time complexity
archival_memory.topics_in_class: dynamic programming, approximation algorithms for NP-hard problems
archival_memory.professor_style: great at explaining complex concepts intuitively
archival_memory.course_structure: lots of reading, group discussions, major project on decentralized file storage system
archival_memory.group_project_challenges: collaborating with different coding styles, integrating code, handling concurrency issues, node failures
archival_memory.professor_background: from the industry, worked on indie games
archival_memory.topics_in_game_design: basic 2D and 3D engines, physics implementation, user experience design
archival_memory.recent_assignment: design a mini-game based on a labyrinth concept, balancing difficulty curve
archival_memory.professor_approach: focus on conceptual understanding over pure math
archival_memory.math_in_class: linear algebra, interspersed with code examples for quantum circuits
archival_memory.topics_in_quantum_computing: modeling basic algorithms like Grover’s and Shor’s
archival_memory.capstone_project_topic: machine learning to analyze social media sentiment for better emergency response
archival_memory.project_scope: analyzing tweets/posts for disaster or crisis indicators, building an interface for real-time alerts
archival_memory.skills_applied: database management, building an API, front-end interface, ML pipeline, project management
archival_memory.course_focus: consciousness, concept of mind, implications for AI
archival_memory.weekly_schedule: Mondays and Wednesdays: Advanced Algorithms, Distributed Systems, Capstone meeting; Tuesdays and Thursdays: Quantum Computing, Game Design, Philosophy of Mind; Fridays: no classes, working on assignments and research.
archival_memory.research_focus: data visualization for big scientific data sets
archival_memory.biggest_challenge: balancing group projects, especially Capstone and Distributed Systems
archival_memory.time_commitment: Capstone: about 10 hours a week; Distributed Systems: significant time investment
archival_memory.group_meeting_frequency: at least twice a week, using Slack or Discord for updates
archival_memory.overall_experience: having a blast, gaining confidence in CS classes
archival_memory.skills_developed: problem-solving, time management, resourcefulness, collaboration, critical thinking
archival_memory.takeaway: classes are tough but rewarding, building toward future career
